author: psmith
msg: Following IOC, the SocketNode's should not need to know whether
their parent Receiver is active or not, they just call the doPost method.
Modified Receiver.doPost so that if !isActive, then the event is ignored.

author: psmith
msg: makes a lot more sense to make the ReceiversToolbar extend
from JToolbar than be some funky JPanel.

author: psmith
msg: added a copy of PluginSkeleton to the sandbox.
This is to add the Active property via Javabean style getter/setters

author: psmith
msg: Moved a copy of Plugin into the sandbox repository.
This is to add the setActive(boolean) JavaBean style setter to compliment
The idea here is that something like Chainsaw should be able to manage
the active nature of a Plugin, and this method needs to be exposed.

author: psmith
msg: removed the isActive property from these classes as they will
